data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=\"i18n.configure({\n  // setup some locales - other locales default to en silently\n  locales: ['en', 'de'],\n\n  // fallback from Dutch to German and from any localized German (de-at, de-li etc.) to German\n  fallbacks: { nl: 'de', 'de-*': 'de' },\n\n  // you may alter a site wide default locale\n  defaultLocale: 'en',\n\n  // will return translation from defaultLocale in case current locale doesn't provide it\n  retryInDefaultLocale: false,\n\n  // sets a custom cookie name to parse locale settings from - defaults to NULL\n  cookie: 'yourcookiename',\n\n  // sets a custom header name to read the language preference from - accept-language header by default\n  header: 'accept-language',\n\n  // query parameter to switch locale (ie. /home?lang=ch) - defaults to NULL\n  queryParameter: 'lang',\n\n  // where to store json files - defaults to './locales' relative to modules directory\n  directory: './mylocales',\n\n  // control mode on directory creation - defaults to NULL which defaults to umask of process user. Setting has no effect on win.\n  directoryPermissions: '755',\n\n  // watch for changes in JSON files to reload locale on updates - defaults to false\n  autoReload: true,\n\n  // whether to write new locale information to disk - defaults to true\n  updateFiles: false,\n\n  // sync locale information across all files - defaults to false\n  syncFiles: false,\n\n  // what to use as the indentation unit - defaults to \u0026quot;\\t\u0026quot;\n  indent: '\\t',\n\n  // setting extension of json files - defaults to '.json' (you might want to set this to '.js' according to webtranslateit)\n  extension: '.json',\n\n  // setting prefix of json files name - default to none '' (in case you use different locale files naming scheme (webapp-en.json), rather then just en.json)\n  prefix: 'webapp-',\n\n  // enable object notation\n  objectNotation: false,\n\n  // setting of log level DEBUG - default to require('debug')('i18n:debug')\n  logDebugFn: function (msg) {\n    console.log('debug', msg)\n  },\n\n  // setting of log level WARN - default to require('debug')('i18n:warn')\n  logWarnFn: function (msg) {\n    console.log('warn', msg)\n  },\n\n  // setting of log level ERROR - default to require('debug')('i18n:error')\n  logErrorFn: function (msg) {\n    console.log('error', msg)\n  },\n\n  // used to alter the behaviour of missing keys\n  missingKeyFn: function (locale, value) {\n    return value\n  },\n\n  // object or [obj1, obj2] to bind the i18n api and current locale to - dir=\"auto\"\u003eSupports the advanced MessageFormat as provided by excellent \u003ca href=\"https://www.npmjs.com/package/@messageformat/core\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003emessageformat module\u003c/a\u003e. You should definetly head over to \u003ca href=\"http://messageformat.github.io/messageformat/api/core/\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003emessageformat.github.io\u003c/a\u003e for a guide to MessageFormat. i18n takes care of \u003ccode\u003enew MessageFormat('en').compile(msg);\u003c/code\u003e with the current \u003ccode\u003emsg\u003c/code\u003e loaded from it's json files and cache that complied fn in memory. So in short you might use it similar to \u003ccode\u003e__()\u003c/code\u003e plus extra object to accomplish MessageFormat's formatting. Ok, some examples:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"highlight highlight-source-js notranslate position-relative overflow-auto\" dir=\"auto\" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=\"// assume res is set to german\nres.setLocale('de')\n\n// start simple\nres.__mf('Hello') // --\u0026gt; Hallo\n\n// can replace too\nres.__mf('Hello {name}', { name: 'Marcus' }) // --\u0026gt; Hallo Marcus\n\n// and combines with sprintf\nres.__mf('Hello {name}, how was your %s?', 'test', { name: 'Marcus' }) // --\u0026gt; Hallo Marcus, wie war dein test?\n\n// now check out a plural rule\nres.__mf('{N, selectordinal, one{# cat} two{# cats} few{# cats} other{# cats}}', {\n  N: 1\n})\n\n// results for \u0026quot;1\u0026quot; in   (all use \u0026quot;one\u0026quot;)\n// en --\u0026gt; 1 cat\n// de --\u0026gt; 1 Katze\n// fr --\u0026gt; 1 chat\n// ru --\u0026gt; 1 кошка       ru uses \u0026quot;__one__\u0026quot; when ending on \u0026quot;1\u0026quot;\n\n// results for \u0026quot;0\u0026quot; in   (most use \u0026quot;others\u0026quot;)\n// en --\u0026gt; 0 cats\n// de --\u0026gt; 0 Katzen\n// fr --\u0026gt; 0 chat        fr uses \u0026quot;__one__\u0026quot; for zero\n// ru --\u0026gt; 0 кошек       ru uses \u0026quot;__many__\u0026quot;\n\n// results for \u0026quot;2\u0026quot; in   (most use \u0026quot;others\u0026quot;)\n// en --\u0026gt; 2 cat\n// de --\u0026gt; 2 Katze\n// fr --\u0026gt; 2 chat\n// ru --\u0026gt; 2 кошки       ru uses \u0026quot;__few__\u0026quot; when ending on \u0026quot;1\u0026quot;\n\n// results for \u0026quot;5\u0026quot; in   (most use \u0026quot;others\u0026quot;)\n// en --\u0026gt; 5 cat\n// de --\u0026gt; 5 Katze\n// fr --\u0026gt; 5 chat\n// ru --\u0026gt; 5 кошек       ru uses \u0026quot;__many__\u0026quot;\n\n// results for \u0026quot;21\u0026quot; in  (most use \u0026quot;others\u0026quot;)\n// en --\u0026gt; 21 cat\n// de --\u0026gt; 21 Katze\n// fr --\u0026gt; 21 chat\n// ru --\u0026gt; 21 кошка       ru uses \u0026quot;__one__\u0026quot; when ending on \u0026quot;1\u0026quot;\"\u003e\u003cpre\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-c\"\u003e// assume res is set to german\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003cspan class=\"pl-s1\"\u003eres\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e.\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-en\"\u003esetLocale\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e(\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-s\"\u003e'de'\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e)\u003c/span\u003e\n\n\u003cspan class=\"pl-c\"\u003e// start simple\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003cspan class=\"pl-s1\"\u003eres\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e.\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-en\"\u003e__mf\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e(\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-s\"\u003e'Hello'\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e)\u003c/span\u003e \u003cspan class=\"pl-c\"\u003e// --\u0026gt; dir=\"auto\"\u003eputting \u003cem\u003eThere is one monkey in the tree\u003c/em\u003e or \u003cem\u003eThere are 3 monkeys in the tree\u003c/em\u003e. Passing all 3 parameters would write a \u003ccode\u003eone\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003eother\u003c/code\u003e to your json. Let's assume the following json snippet:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"highlight highlight-source-json notranslate position-relative overflow-auto\" dir=\"auto\" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=\"\u0026quot;dogs\u0026quot;: {\n    \u0026quot;one\u0026quot;: \u0026quot;one dog\u0026quot;,\n    \u0026quot;other\u0026quot;: \u0026quot;[0] no dog|[2,5] some dogs|[6,11] many dogs|[12,36] dozens of dogs|a horde of %s dogs|[100,] too many dogs\u0026quot;\n}\"\u003e\u003cpre\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-ent\"\u003e\"dogs\"\u003c/span\u003e: {\n    \u003cspan class=\"pl-ent\"\u003e\"one\"\u003c/span\u003e: \u003cspan class=\"pl-s\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-pds\"\u003e\"\u003c/span\u003eone dog\u003cspan class=\"pl-pds\"\u003e\"\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e,\n    \u003cspan class=\"pl-ent\"\u003e\"other\"\u003c/span\u003e: \u003cspan class=\"pl-s\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-pds\"\u003e\"\u003c/span\u003e[0] no dog|[2,5] some dogs|[6,11] many dogs|[12,36] dozens of dogs|a horde of %s dogs|[100,] too many dogs\u003cspan class=\"pl-pds\"\u003e\"\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n}\u003c/pre\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003ethis will result in\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"highlight highlight-source-js notranslate position-relative overflow-auto\" dir=\"auto\" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=\"__n('dogs', 0) // --\u0026gt; no dog\n__n('dogs', 1) // --\u0026gt; one dog\n__n('dogs', 2) // --\u0026gt; some dogs\n__n('dogs', 10) // --\u0026gt; many dogs\n__n('dogs', 25) // --\u0026gt; dozens of dogs\n__n('dogs', 42) // --\u0026gt; a horde of 42 dogs\n__n('dogs', 199) // --\u0026gt; too many dogs\"\u003e\u003cpre\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-en\"\u003e__n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e(\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-s\"\u003e'dogs'\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e,\u003c/span\u003e \u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003e0\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e)\u003c/span\u003e \u003cspan class=\"pl-c\"\u003e// --\u0026gt; no dog\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003cspan class=\"pl-en\"\u003e__n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e(\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-s\"\u003e'dogs'\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e,\u003c/span\u003e \u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003e1\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e)\u003c/span\u003e \u003cspan class=\"pl-c\"\u003e// --\u0026gt; one dog\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003cspan class=\"pl-en\"\u003e__n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e(\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-s\"\u003e'dogs'\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e,\u003c/span\u003e \u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003e2\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e)\u003c/span\u003e \u003cspan class=\"pl-c\"\u003e// --\u0026gt; some dogs\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003cspan class=\"pl-en\"\u003e__n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e(\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-s\"\u003e'dogs'\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e,\u003c/span\u003e \u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003e10\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e)\u003c/span\u003e \u003cspan class=\"pl-c\"\u003e// --\u0026gt; many dogs\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003cspan class=\"pl-en\"\u003e__n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e(\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-s\"\u003e'dogs'\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e,\u003c/span\u003e \u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003e25\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e)\u003c/span\u003e \u003cspan class=\"pl-c\"\u003e// --\u0026gt; dozens of dogs\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003cspan class=\"pl-en\"\u003e__n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e(\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-s\"\u003e'dogs'\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e,\u003c/span\u003e \u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003e42\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e)\u003c/span\u003e \u003cspan class=\"pl-c\"\u003e// --\u0026gt; too many dogs\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/pre\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eThe rules are parsed in sequenced order, so the first match will skip any extra rules. Example:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"highlight highlight-source-json notranslate position-relative overflow-auto\" dir=\"auto\" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=\"{\n    \u0026quot;dogs\u0026quot;:\u0026quot;[0]no dog|[1]one dog|[,10[ less than ten dogs|[,20[ less than 20 dogs|too many dogs\u0026quot;\n}\"\u003e\u003cpre\u003e{\n    \u003cspan class=\"pl-ent\"\u003e\"dogs\"\u003c/span\u003e:\u003cspan class=\"pl-s\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-pds\"\u003e\"\u003c/span\u003e[0]no dog|[1]one dog|[,10[ less than ten dogs|[,20[ less than 20 dogs|too many dogs\u003cspan class=\"pl-pds\"\u003e\"\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n}\u003c/pre\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eresults in\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"highlight highlight-source-js notranslate position-relative overflow-auto\" dir=\"auto\" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=\"// interval matched by number\n__n('dogs', 0) // --\u0026gt; no dog\n__n('dogs', 1) // --\u0026gt; one dog\n__n('dogs', 2) // --\u0026gt; less than ten dogs\n__n('dogs', 9) // --\u0026gt; less than ten dogs\n__n('dogs', 10) // --\u0026gt; less than 20 dogs\n__n('dogs', 19) // --\u0026gt; less than 20 dogs\n__n('dogs', 20) // --\u0026gt; too many dogs\n__n('dogs', 199) // --\u0026gt; too many dogs\n\n// no interval returned, but found a catchall\n__('dogs') // --\u0026gt; too many dogs\"\u003e\u003cpre\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-c\"\u003e// interval matched by number\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003cspan class=\"pl-en\"\u003e__n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e(\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-s\"\u003e'dogs'\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e,\u003c/span\u003e \u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003e0\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e)\u003c/span\u003e \u003cspan class=\"pl-c\"\u003e// --\u0026gt; no dog\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003cspan class=\"pl-en\"\u003e__n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e(\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-s\"\u003e'dogs'\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e,\u003c/span\u003e \u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003e1\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e)\u003c/span\u003e \u003cspan class=\"pl-c\"\u003e// --\u0026gt; one dog\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003cspan class=\"pl-en\"\u003e__n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e(\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-s\"\u003e'dogs'\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e,\u003c/span\u003e \u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003e2\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e)\u003c/span\u003e \u003cspan class=\"pl-c\"\u003e// --\u0026gt; Each phrase might get decorated further with mustache and sprintf expressions:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"highlight highlight-source-json notranslate position-relative overflow-auto\" dir=\"auto\" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=\"{\n    \u0026quot;example\u0026quot;:\u0026quot;[0] %s is zero rule for {{me}}|[2,5] %s is between two and five for {{me}}|and a catchall rule for {{me}} to get my number %s\u0026quot;\n}\"\u003e\u003cpre\u003e{\n    \u003cspan class=\"pl-ent\"\u003e\"example\"\u003c/span\u003e:\u003cspan class=\"pl-s\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-pds\"\u003e\"\u003c/span\u003e[0] %s is zero rule for {{me}}|[2,5] %s is between two and five for {{me}}|and a catchall rule for {{me}} to get my number %s\u003cspan class=\"pl-pds\"\u003e\"\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n}\u003c/pre\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003ewill put (as taken from tests):\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"highlight highlight-source-js notranslate position-relative overflow-auto\" dir=\"auto\" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=\"// will always use a found catchall\n__('example', {me: 'marcus'}) // --\u0026gt; sure to set \u003ccode\u003eobjectNotation\u003c/code\u003e to \u003ccode\u003etrue\u003c/code\u003e in your \u003ccode\u003econfigure()\u003c/code\u003e call. delimiter you like.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eInstead of calling \u003ccode\u003e__(\"Hello\")\u003c/code\u003e you might call \u003ccode\u003e__(\"greeting.formal\")\u003c/code\u003e When making use of it, the \"one\" and \"other\" entries are used implicitly for an object in the translation document. For example, consider the following document:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"highlight highlight-source-json notranslate position-relative overflow-auto\" dir=\"auto\" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=\"{\n  \u0026quot;pets\u0026quot;: {\n    \u0026quot;cat\u0026quot;: {\n      \u0026quot;one\u0026quot;: \u0026quot;Katze\u0026quot;,\n      \u0026quot;other\u0026quot;: \u0026quot;Katzen\u0026quot;\n    }\n  }\n}\"\u003e\u003cpre\u003e{\n  \u003cspan class=\"pl-ent\"\u003e\"pets\"\u003c/span\u003e: {\n    \u003cspan class=\"pl-ent\"\u003e\"cat\"\u003c/span\u003e: {\n      \u003cspan class=\"pl-ent\"\u003e\"one\"\u003c/span\u003e: \u003cspan class=\"pl-s\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-pds\"\u003e\"\u003c/span\u003eKatze\u003cspan class=\"pl-pds\"\u003e\"\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e,\n      \u003cspan class=\"pl-ent\"\u003e\"other\"\u003c/span\u003e: \u003cspan class=\"pl-s\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-pds\"\u003e\"\u003c/span\u003eKatzen\u003cspan class=\"pl-pds\"\u003e\"\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n    }\n  }\n}\u003c/pre\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eWhen accessing these, you would use \u003ccode\u003e__n(\"pets.cat\", \"pets.cat\", 3)\u003c/code\u003e to tell i18n to use both the singular and plural form of the \"cat\" entry. dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003ei18n:debug\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003ei18n:warn\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003ei18n:error\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eif you only Supports plain vanilla Node.js apps and should work with any framework (like <em>Express</em>, <em>restify</em> and probably more) that exposes an <code>app.use()</code> method passing in <code>res</code> and <code>req</code> objects.Uses common __('...') syntax in app and templates.Stores language files in json files compatible to <a href="http://webtranslateit.com/" rel="nofollow">webtranslateit</a> json format.Adds new strings on-the-fly when first used in your app.No extra parsing needed.</p><p dir="auto"><a target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer" The first configured locale 'en' will default in case the browser doesn't include any of those locales in his request.</p><hr><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h2 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Usage</h2><a id="user-content-usage" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: Usage" href="#usage"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">With <strong>0.12.0</strong> <code>i18n</code> now provides options to be used as instance or singleton.</p><ul dir="auto"><li><strong>Instances</strong> allow to work with multiple different configurations and encapsulate resources and states.</li><li><strong>Singletons</strong> allow to share configuration, state and resources across multiple requires, modules or files.</li></ul><p dir="auto">Before <strong>0.12.0</strong> <em>singleton usage</em> was the only option. Instances give much more intuitive control and should be considered the "better practice" in complex setups.</p><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">As Instance</h3><a id="user-content-as-instance" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: As Instance" href="#as-instance"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="var greeting = i18n.__('Hello')"><pre><span class="pl-k">var</span> <span class="pl-s1">greeting</span> <span class="pl-c1">=</span> <span dir="auto"><strong>Global</strong> assumes you share a common state of localization in any time and any part of your app. This is usually fine in cli-style scripts. When serving responses to http requests you'll need to make sure that scope is <strong>NOT</strong> shared globally but attached to your request object.</p></blockquote><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Middleware in express.js</h3><a id="user-content-middleware-in-expressjs" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: Middleware in That means, it should not change nor remove any aspect of the current api but new features and options will get added that don't break compatibility backwards within a major version.</p><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">i18n.configure()</h3><a id="user-content-i18nconfigure" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: i18n.configure()" href="#i18nconfigure"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">You should configure your application once to bootstrap all aspects of <code>i18n</code>. You should not configure i18n in each loop when used in an http based scenario. During configuration, <code>i18n</code> reads all known locales into memory and prepares to keep that superfast object in sync with your files in filesystem  as configured</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-js notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="i18n.configure({  locales: ['en', 'de'],  directory: path.join(__dirname, 'locales')})"><pre><span class="pl-s1">i18n</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">configure</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-kos">{</span>  <span class="pl-c1">locales</span>: <span class="pl-kos">[</span><span class="pl-s">'en'</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span> <span class="pl-s">'de'</span><span class="pl-kos">]</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span>  <span class="pl-c1">directory</span>: <span class="pl-s1">path</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">join</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s1">__dirname</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span> <span class="pl-s">'locales'</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span><span class="pl-kos">}</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span></pre></div><p dir="auto"><strong>Since 0.7.0</strong> you may even omit the <code>locales</code> setting and just configure a <code>directory</code>. <code>i18n</code> will read all files within that directory and detect all given locales by their filenames.</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-js notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="i18n.configure({ class="pl-s1">__dirname</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span> <span class="pl-s">'locales'</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span><span class="pl-kos">}</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span><span German (de-at, de-li etc.) to German  fallbacks: { nl: 'de', 'de-*': 'de' },  // you may alter a site wide default locale  defaultLocale: 'en',  // will return translation from defaultLocale in case current locale doesn't provide it  retryInDefaultLocale: false,  // sets a custom cookie name to parse locale settings from - defaults to NULL  cookie: 'yourcookiename',  // sets a custom header name to read the language preference from - accept-language header by default  header: 'accept-language',  // query parameter to switch locale (ie. /home?lang=ch) - defaults to NULL  queryParameter: 'lang',  // where to store json files - defaults to './locales' relative to modules directory  directory: './mylocales',  // control mode on directory creation - defaults to NULL which defaults to umask of process user. Setting has no effect on win.  directoryPermissions: '755',  // watch for changes in JSON files to reload locale on updates - defaults to false  autoReload: true,  // whether to write new locale information to disk - defaults to true  updateFiles: false,  // sync locale information across all files - defaults to false  syncFiles: false,  // what to use as the indentation unit - defaults to "\t"  indent: '\t',  // setting extension of json files - by header, cookie or query parameter depending on your setup.</p><p dir="auto">In case of cookie you will also need to enable cookies for your application. For express this done by adding <code>app.use(express.cookieParser())</code>). Now use the same cookie name when setting it in the user preferred language, like here:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-js notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="res.cookie('yourcookiename', 'de', { maxAge: 900000, httpOnly: true })"><pre><span class="pl-s1">res</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">cookie</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s">'yourcookiename'</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span> <span class="pl-s">'de'</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span> <span class="pl-kos">{</span> <span class="pl-c1">maxAge</span>: <span class="pl-c1">900000</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span> <span class="pl-c1">httpOnly</span>: <span class="pl-c1">true</span> <span class="pl-kos">}</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span></pre></div><p dir="auto">After this and until the cookie expires, <code>i18n.init()</code> will get the value of the cookie to set that language instead of default for every page.</p><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h4 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Some words on <code>register</code> option</h4><a id="user-content-some-words-on-register-option" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: Some words on register option" href="#some-words-on-register-option"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">Used especially in a CLI-like script. You won't use any <code>i18n.init()</code> to guess language settings from your user, thus <code>i18n</code> won't bind itself to any <code>res</code> or <code>req</code> object and will work like a static module.</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-js notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="var anyObject = {}i18n.configure({  locales: ['en', 'de'],  register: anyObject})anyObject.setLocale('de')anyObject.__('Hallo') // --> Hallo"><pre><span class="pl-k">var</span> <span class="pl-s1">anyObject</span> <span class="pl-c1">=</span> <span class="pl-kos">{</span><span class="pl-kos">}</span><span class="pl-s1">i18n</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">configure</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-kos">{</span>  <span class="pl-c1">locales</span>: <span class="pl-kos">[</span><span class="pl-s">'en'</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span> <span class="pl-s">'de'</span><span class="pl-kos">]</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span>  <span class="pl-c1">register</span>: <span class="pl-s1">anyObject</span><span class="pl-kos">}</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span><span class="pl-s1">anyObject</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">setLocale</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s">'de'</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span><span class="pl-s1">anyObject</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">__</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s">'Hallo'</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span> <span class="pl-c">// --> Hallo</span></pre></div><p dir="auto">Cli usage is a special use case, as we won't need to maintain any transaction / concurrency aware setting of locale, so you could even choose to bind <code>i18n</code> to <em>global</em> scope of node:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-js notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="i18n.configure({  locales: ['en', 'de'],  register: global})i18n.setLocale('de')__('Hello') // --> Hallo"><pre><span class="pl-s1">i18n</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">configure</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-kos">{</span>  <span class="pl-c1">locales</span>: <span class="pl-kos">[</span><span class="pl-s">'en'</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span> <span class="pl-s">'de'</span><span class="pl-kos">]</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span>  <span class="pl-c1">register</span>: <span class="pl-s1">global</span><span class="pl-kos">}</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span><span class="pl-s1">i18n</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">setLocale</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s">'de'</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span><span class="pl-c1">__</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s">'Hello'</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span> <span class="pl-c">// --> Hallo</span></pre></div><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h4 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Some words on <code>staticCatalog</code> option</h4><a id="user-content-some-words-on-staticcatalog-option" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: Some words on staticCatalog option" href="#some-words-on-staticcatalog-option"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">Instead of letting i18n load translations from a given directory you may pass translations as static js object right on configuration. This supports any method that returns a <code>key:value</code> translation object (<code>{ Hello: 'Hallo', Cat: 'Katze' }</code>). So you might even mix native <strong>json</strong> with <strong>js</strong> modules and parsed <strong>yaml</strong> files, like so:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-js notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="// DEMO: quickly add yaml supportconst yaml = require('js-yaml')const fs = require('fs')// configure and load translations from different locationsi18n.configure({  staticCatalog: {    de: require('../../locales/de-as-json.json'),    en: require('../../locales/en-as-module.js'),    fr: yaml.safeLoad(fs.readFileSync('../../locales/fr-as-yaml.yml', 'utf8'))  },  defaultLocale: 'de'})"><pre><span class="pl-c">// DEMO: quickly add yaml support</span><span class="pl-k">const</span> <span class="pl-s1">yaml</span> <span class="pl-c1">=</span> <span class="pl-en">require</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s">'js-yaml'</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span><span class="pl-k">const</span> <span class="pl-s1">fs</span> <span class="pl-c1">=</span> <span class="pl-en">require</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s">'fs'</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span><span class="pl-c">// configure and load translations from different locations</span><span class="pl-s1">i18n</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">configure</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-kos">{</span>  <span class="pl-c1">staticCatalog</span>: <span class="pl-kos">{</span>    <span class="pl-c1">de</span>: <span class="pl-en">require</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s">'../../locales/de-as-json.json'</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span>    <span class="pl-c1">en</span>: <span class="pl-en">require</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s">'../../locales/en-as-module.js'</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span>    <span class="pl-c1">fr</span>: <span class="pl-s1">yaml</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">safeLoad</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s1">fs</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">readFileSync</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s">'../../locales/fr-as-yaml.yml'</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span> <span class="pl-s">'utf8'</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span>  <span class="pl-kos">}</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span>  <span class="pl-c1">defaultLocale</span>: <span class="pl-s">'de'</span><span class="pl-kos">}</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span></pre></div><p dir="auto"><strong>NOTE:</strong> Enabling <code>staticCatalog</code> disables all other fs realated options such as <code>updateFiles</code>,  <code>autoReload</code> and <code>syncFiles</code></p><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h4 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Some words on <code>parser</code> option</h4><a id="user-content-some-words-on-parser-option" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: Some words can parse them as YAML or any other format you like</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-js notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="const YAML = require('yaml')i18n.configure({  extension: '.yml',  parser: YAML})"><pre><span class="pl-k">const</span> <span class="pl-c1">YAML</span> <span class="pl-c1">=</span> <span class="pl-c1">parser</span>: <span class="pl-c1">YAML</span><span class="pl-kos">}</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span></pre></div><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">i18n.init()</h3><a id="user-content-i18ninit" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: i18n.init()" href="#i18ninit"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">When used as middleware in frameworks like express to setup the current environment for each loop. In contrast to configure the <code>i18n.init()</code> should be called within each request-response-cycle.</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-js notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="var app = express()app.use(cookieParser())app.use(i18n.init)"><pre><span class="pl-k">var</span> <span class="pl-s1">app</span> <span class="pl-c1">=</span> <span class="pl-en">express</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span><span class="pl-s1">app</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">use</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-en">cookieParser</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span><span class="pl-s1">app</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">use</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s1">i18n</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-c1">init</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span></pre></div><p dir="auto">When i18n is used like this, the <code>i18n.init()</code> tries to</p><ol dir="auto"><li>guess the language of a visitor by it's browser settings, cookie or query parameter</li><li>set that language in any of the "usual" objects provided by the framework</li></ol><p dir="auto">Express would call <code>i18n.init(req, res, next)</code>, which is "classic" and adopted by many frameworks. Thus <code>i18n</code> will attach it's api to that schema:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-js notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="{  req: {    locals: {},    res: {      locals: {},    }  }}"><pre><span class="pl-kos">{</span>  <span class="pl-c1">req</span>: <span class="pl-kos">{</span>    <span class="pl-c1">locals</span>: <span class="pl-kos">{</span><span class="pl-kos">}</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span>    <span class="pl-c1">res</span>: <span class="pl-kos">{</span>      <span class="pl-c1">locals</span>: <span class="pl-kos">{</span><span class="pl-kos">}</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span>    <span class="pl-kos">}</span>  <span class="pl-kos">}</span><span class="pl-kos">}</span></pre></div><p dir="auto">and add it's extra attributes and methods, like so:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-js notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="{  req: {    locals: {      locale: "de",      __: [function],      __n: [function],      [...]    },    res: {      locals: {        locale: "de",        __: class="pl-kos">,</span>    <span class="pl-s1">__n</span>: <span class="pl-kos">[</span><span class="pl-k">function</span><span class="pl-kos">]</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span>    <span class="pl-kos">[</span>...<span class="pl-kos">]</span>  <span class="pl-kos">}</span><span class="pl-kos">}</span><span class="pl-kos"></span></pre></div><p dir="auto">Now each <em>local</em> object 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">Supports the advanced MessageFormat as provided by excellent <a href="https://www.npmjs.com/package/@messageformat/core" rel="nofollow">messageformat module</a>. You should definetly head over to <a href="http://messageformat.github.io/messageformat/api/core/" rel="nofollow">messageformat.github.io</a> for a guide to MessageFormat. i18n takes care of <code>new MessageFormat('en').compile(msg);</code> with the current <code>msg</code> loaded from it's json files and cache that complied fn in memory. So in short you might use it similar to <code>__()</code> plus extra object to accomplish MessageFormat's formatting. 21 chat</span><span class="pl-c">// ru --> 21 кошка       ru uses "__one__" when ending on "1"</span></pre></div><p dir="auto">Take a look at <a href="https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Mozilla/Localization/Localization_and_Plurals" rel="nofollow">Mozilla</a> to quickly get an idea of what pluralization has to deal with. With <code>__mf()</code> you get a very powerful tool, but you need to handle it correctly.</p><p dir="auto">But MessageFormat can handle more! You get ability to process:</p><ul dir="auto"><li>Simple Variable Replacement (similar to mustache placeholders)</li><li>SelectFormat (ie. switch msg based on gender)</li><li><a href="http://messageformat.github.io/messageformat/guide/#pluralformat" rel="nofollow">PluralFormat</a> (see above and <a href="#ranged-interval-support">ranges</a>)</li></ul><p dir="auto">Combinations of those give superpower, but should get tested well (contribute your use case, please!) on integration.</p><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">i18n.__l()</h3><a id="user-content-i18n__l" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: i18n.__l()" href="#i18n__l"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">Returns a list of translations for a given phrase in each language.</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-js notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="i18n.__l('Hello') // --> [ 'Hallo', 'Hello' ]"><pre><span class="pl-s1">i18n</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span will be usefull when setting up localized routes for example (kudos to @xpepermint, #150):</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-js notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="// this will match routes// EN --> /:locale/products/:id?// ES --> /:locale/productos/:id?app.get(__l('/:locale/products/:id?'), function (req, res) {  // guess guess what you might use req.params.locale for?</span><span class="pl-kos">}</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span></pre></div><blockquote><p dir="auto">i18n.__ln() to get plurals will come up in another globally or in current scope.</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-js notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="setLocale('de')setLocale(req, 'de')req.setLocale('de')"><pre><span class="pl-en">setLocale</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s">'de'</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span><span class="pl-en">setLocale</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s1">req</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span> <span class="pl-s">'de'</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span><span class="pl-s1">req</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">setLocale</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s">'de'</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span></pre></div><p dir="auto">Use setLocale to change any initial locale that was set in <code>i18n.init()</code>. You get more control on how when and which objects get setup with a given locale. Locale values are inherited within the given schema like in <code>i18n.init()</code> Let's see some examples:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-js notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="i18n.setLocale(req, 'ar') // --> req: مرحبا res: مرحبا res.locals: مرحباi18n.setLocale(res, 'ar') // --> req: Hallo res: مرحبا res.locals: مرحباi18n.setLocale(res.locals, 'ar') // --> req: Hallo res: Hallo res.locals: مرحبا"><pre><span class="pl-s1">i18n</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">setLocale</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s1">req</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span> <span class="pl-s">'ar'</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span> <span class="pl-c">// --> req: مرحبا res: مرحبا res.locals: مرحبا</span><span class="pl-s1">i18n</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">setLocale</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s1">res</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span> <span class="pl-s">'ar'</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span> <span class="pl-c">// --> req: Hallo res: مرحبا res.locals: مرحبا</span><span class="pl-s1">i18n</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">setLocale</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s1">res</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-c1">locals</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span> <span class="pl-s">'ar'</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span> <span class="pl-c">// --> req: Hallo res: Hallo res.locals: مرحبا</span></pre></div><p dir="auto">You'll get even more control when passing an array of objects:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-js notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="i18n.setLocale([req, res.locals], req.params.lang) // --> req: مرحبا res: Hallo res.locals: مرحبا"><pre><span class="pl-s1">i18n</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">setLocale</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-kos">[</span><span class="pl-s1">req</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span> <span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-c1">params</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-c1">lang</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span> <span class="pl-c">// --> req: مرحبا res: Hallo res.locals: مرحبا</span></pre></div><p dir="auto">or disable inheritance by passing true as third parameter:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-js notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="i18n.setLocale(res, 'ar', true) // --> req: Hallo res: مرحبا res.locals: Hallo"><pre><span class="pl-s1">i18n</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span href="#attaching-helpers-for-template-engines"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0
